title: Firefox Sync Not Working With Passwords
content:
My firefox was running slow. It offered me the option to, in a way, re-set itself (almost as if I unistalled it and re-installed it). I did it, and then had to re-upload my bookmarks and such. The bookmarks I was able to do with no firefox account, but for passwords, it required me to make one, so I did it quickly and easily with my gmail.

The problem is, to import logins and passowrds, it keeps telling me to 'Go to the Sync options' and tick the 'Logins and Passwords box' (in the about:preferences#sync page).

I do it, click the 'Syncronize now' option and then it asks me to change primary passwords. I never had one, so it asked me instead to make one.

No matter how many I create, even with the quality meter being full, firefox tells me they are unnable to change my primary password - which didn't even exist to begin with. So I don't know what's going on: i never had a primary password, and whenever I try to create one, firefox is unnable to do it so.

I don't know if maybe I have to activate some other kind of autentification method unknown to me, but if so, that's just a huge headache. How many passwords and logins must I have just to import my passwords and logins?

I'm letting you all know at least of this problem, which if can be solved easily, would be nice. As someone that loved mozilla, this leaves me quite sad . I get the passion for security, but this is an headache and a waste of time honestly.
creator: nescorreia24

title: Embedded youtube videos "An Error occured. Try again later" error
content:
Hey all,

So I have issue with youtube videos playback outside of youtube. When embedded on 3rd party site after pressing play buffer icon spins for a while then throws back message with error. While 'buffering' I am able to click youtube icon to go straight to youtube.com and watch video there without any issues at all.

In private mode - it works as intended (didn't try safe mode due to that). So I've cleared cache - an error happened. Then also cleared cookies (bit pissed off since I have to log in and set stuff back again on every site) - it helped and videos started to work again. But after not more like 2 or 3 times when it worked correctly it started to crash again. Other browsers seem to work just fine.

I've been also looking here for a resolution. Found few topics with same issue. Answers usually lead to two sites. One is reddit where main post was deleted and nothing interesting is given down bellow in the comments. Other site is a topic from 2014 saying to uninstall Flash Player. I don't have flash player since it is not supported anymore in 2021.

Any ideas?
creator: steelek

title: Two FF windows open when I click a link in Outlook
content:
I'm using Outlook in my iMac Pro running Big Sur 11.1, and when I click a link in an email, two FF windows open, one with my default homepage and the other from the link.

This only happens when FF isn't already open.

I've adjusted the settings to no avail, and then reset FF but the problem remains.

It doesn't do this with other browsers when set as the default, just FF.

I see other posts relating to this issue, but cannot find the solution - if there is one?

Thank you.

title: How to make Firefox ask before closing?
content:
in about:config page the options: browser.tabs.warnOnClose (true - default) browser.tabs.warnOnCloseOtherTabs (true - default) browser.sessionstore.warnOnQuit (false - default) browser.warnOnQuit true (true - default)

But when i do Ctrl+q accidentally, it closes the only Firefox window i have. This window has many tabs open. Yes it restore next time, but i want FF to ask me before closing it.

FF 84.0.1 Arch Linux

title: Missing Session Restore Files
content:
I have "Restore previous session" checked but when I restart my computer Firefox does not start with the previous session. Currently I have many tabs open and need to restart Windows but I looked in my profiles folder and do not see any of the session files and backup folders.

Why are the session files (sessionstore.jsonlz4, recovery.jsonlz4, recovery.baklz4, previous.jsonlz4, sessionstore-backups) missing from the profile folder?

I can't restart Windows because I don't want to lose my tabs. How do I get Firefox to save the session to disk?

title: Problemas com Firefox e macOS Big Sur
content:
Olá! Estou tendo problemas com o Firefox e macOS Big Sur. Tanto o sistema operacional quanto o navegador estão atualizados na última versão oficialmente disponível para o público, e mesmo assim o problema persiste.

O que acontece é que quando uso o tema "Claro" (Light) no sistema operacional, o Firefox não altera cores de fontes, então ao digitar na barra de endereço, as letras são claras e não podem ser lidas. Anexei uma screenshot para ilustrar melhor.

Outro problema que tenho, independente do tema aplicado ao sistema operacional, seja claro ou escuro, é que ao selecionar um texto qualquer com o cursor, não aparece o "grifado", indicando a porção do texto que foi selecionada. Isso ocorre em qualquer campo da página. Eu consigo selecionar e manipular o texto, porém sem saber com exatidão o que realmente foi selecionado.

Para que fique registrado, a única extensão de navegador que tenho instalada é a adBlock, e ela não parece ter qualquer relação com o problema.

Agradeço desde já!

Beto.
creator: betogzo

creator: ebetf

title: Firefox very slow (vs Edge)
content:
Long time Firefox user here - been on from the start (about 2005), and don't want to switch because I love some features like the Panorama View extension, Context Search extension etc, and it's always been a great browser.

Recently though (not sure if it's just recently, or I've only just noticed), it's so slow. I tried a brand new profile, no extensions, no settings changes, and it's the same. Example loading times:

bbc.co.uk/news Firefox: 14s Edge: 2s chess.com Firefox: 19s Edge: 4s chess.com play vs computer Firefox 38s Edge 2s

https://youtu.be/er9jBysL0vEFirefox vs Edge (YouTube)

So it's not my profile settings or extensions.

BUT, I tried it on a different user profile on the same computer (Switch User from the Windows Start menu), and it's fast!

Why is this, and what do I need to do on my user account to speed Firefox up (keeping my same Firefox profile)?

Thanks in advance.
creator: rjones.zx

content:
